SENT.plain: Involuntary episodic movements associated with transient cerebral ischemia are a rare but well-described presentation of carotid artery occlusive disease
We describe a young man with a left carotid artery occlusion who presented with daily episodes of involuntary movements of the right side that occurred for months
His symptoms virtually disappeared after his antihypertensive drug was reduced
This case supports the possibility of noninvasive management of this condition, which is traditionally treated with revascularization procedures
